title.native: アルジェント ソーマ

description:
In the year 2059, the earth has been plagued by aliens for several years. In an effort to learn more about these aliens, Dr. Noguchi and his assistants Maki Agata and Takuto Kenishiro try to revive the professor's experiment, a large Bio-Mechanical alien named Frank. During this process the alien comes to 'life' and the lab is subsequently destroyed leaving Takuto the only survivor and the alien disappearing into the wilderness. While Frank roams the wilderness he meets Hattie, an emotionally distressed young girl whose parents are killed in the first 'close encounter' war. Oddly enough she is able to communicate with Frank and soon after they are taken into custody by a secret agency known only as 'Funeral'. Meanwhile, Takuto wakes up in a hospital bed with his life in shambles, and his face disfigured. Motivated by vengeance and heart break, Takuto accepts an offer from the mysterious 'Mr. X' and receives a new identity as a ranking Funeral officer named Ryu Soma.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Aviation
tags.description: Regarding the flying or operation of aircraft.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

node.description:
Started his career as an in-betweener for [Nakamura Production](https://anilist.co/studio/6658/Nakamura-Production) working on several outsourced episodes of [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise) shows. 

He had his breakthrough as animator on [Yoroiden Samurai Troopers](https://anilist.co/anime/1264/) where his detailed art and animation attracted attention. He was thus selected to be character designer for the sequel, [Yoroiden Samurai Troopers Gaiden](https://anilist.co/anime/1265/), and later animation director for the [Mobile Suit Gundam F91](https://anilist.co/anime/88/) movie. 

Since then he's been heavily involved in Sunrise productions, both as animator and as character designer. Notable examples of his designs are those for [Mobile Suit Gundam Wing](https://anilist.co/anime/90/) and [Argento Soma](https://anilist.co/anime/285/).

He had his debut as a director with [Witch Hunter Robin](https://anilist.co/anime/7/), after which he directed the acclaimed [Ergo Proxy](https://anilist.co/anime/790/). More recent works of his include the adaptation of [Gangsta](https://anilist.co/anime/20773/), as well as the [Mobile Suit Gundam Hathaway](https://anilist.co/anime/105595/) trilogy.

__Notable works outside Anime:__

- Final Fantasy IX (Video Game, 2000) (Character Design)

Katsuhisa Hattori was a Japanese classical composer who wrote music for anime films, television series, and OVAs. In the west, he was best known for his soundtrack compositions for [Argento Soma](https://anilist.co/anime/285/Argento-Soma/) and [Hiroyuki Morioka](https://anilist.co/staff/97473/Hiroyuki-Morioka)'s [Seikai](https://anilist.co/anime/290/Crest-of-the-Stars/) series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakouyukie) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BD%90%E5%85%89%E5%B9%B8%E6%81%B5)

Yukie Sakou is an animator and character designer.
__Kitagawa Keiko__ is a Japanese lyricist. Note: Not to confuse her with the much younger famous pop-star Kitagawa Keiko.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/菅井えり)

She was the wife of musician Itaru Watanabe.

[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.

Started his career as an in-betweener for [Nakamura Production](https://anilist.co/studio/6658/Nakamura-Production) working on several outsourced episodes of [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/Sunrise) shows. 

He had his breakthrough as animator on [Yoroiden Samurai Troopers](https://anilist.co/anime/1264/) where his detailed art and animation attracted attention. He was thus selected to be character designer for the sequel, [Yoroiden Samurai Troopers Gaiden](https://anilist.co/anime/1265/), and later animation director for the [Mobile Suit Gundam F91](https://anilist.co/anime/88/) movie. 

Since then he's been heavily involved in Sunrise productions, both as animator and as character designer. Notable examples of his designs are those for [Mobile Suit Gundam Wing](https://anilist.co/anime/90/) and [Argento Soma](https://anilist.co/anime/285/).

He had his debut as a director with [Witch Hunter Robin](https://anilist.co/anime/7/), after which he directed the acclaimed [Ergo Proxy](https://anilist.co/anime/790/). More recent works of his include the adaptation of [Gangsta](https://anilist.co/anime/20773/), as well as the [Mobile Suit Gundam Hathaway](https://anilist.co/anime/105595/) trilogy.

__Notable works outside Anime:__

- Final Fantasy IX (Video Game, 2000) (Character Design)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamayama800) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山口宏_(脚本家%29)

He's Japanese screenwriter and novelist, and one of the founders of Studio [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/GONZO).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fusatora2828) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/mangetsuhakase)

While attending Waseda University, Mochizuki became interested in animation and he joined the Waseda University Animation Association. In 1981, he began working for Ajia-do Animation Works. Mochizuki made his debut one year later when he acted as production director of the 1982 series Tokimeki Tonight. He went on to direct several of the magical girl series, including Magical Angel Creamy Mami. In 1986, he moved up to chief director with Hikari no Densetsu.

Mochizuki became known from the early 1990s as director of Ranma ½, Kimagure Orange Road and the Studio Ghibli TV movie Ocean Waves, he is also known for having directed Twin Spica, Zettai Shounen, the acclaimed World Masterpiece Theater series Porphy no Nagai Tabi. More recently he directed the noitaminA series House of Five Leaves in 2010 and Battery in 2016.

He currently divides his time between directing, writing scripts and acting as a series coordinator for various shows.

Married to [Masako Gotou](https://anilist.co/staff/153654/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kakudou) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/角銅博之)

Hiroyuki Kakudou, also known as Hiroki Kudou, is a Japanese anime director. He is best known for directing the first two Digimon series.

Kakudou is a graduate of Tokyo University and has formerly belonged to Toei Animation where he learned to work as a director, and was also involved as a production assistant, storyboarder and director on episodes on series like Slam Dunk and Gegege no Kitarou.

Kakudou is currently a freelance director and a member of the animation production group "Group Ebisen" (グループえびせん).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asakonishida) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/24387) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西田亜沙子)

Originating from Studio Muu.


Married to fellow animator [Seiichi Nakatani](https://anilist.co/staff/107409/Seiichi-Nakatani).
